Entries.default: The air is as warm and muggy as a drunkard's breath, yet the elf stands with her arms tightly crossed.

The elf jumps back as the door opens. She has her weapon raised, ready to attack.

But seeing you, she slowly lowers it.
"Got something for me?"
"It's you. But how'd you get through there?" She peers through the door, looking at the shrine on the other side.
"I found the old temple in a flooded spot where the falls meet."
"I found another 'cornett' in the ruins."
[Present the Cornett of Waves.] "I have what you're looking for."
"What exactly are you doing down here?"
"Farewell."

"Good work. I'll make sure no one else disturbs it."

She claps you on the shoulder.
"I don't care where you found it as long as it gets us through that door."
She inspects the shell but does not take it.

"Thought we'd been through this. I'm waiting for you to bring the goods so we can find Dereo's mosaic and be out of here." Her gaze darts around as if she's expecting something to jump out from the shadows.
"Meantime, Dereo'll be pleased to hear the news. How about you go tell him and collect your reward."
"Just so you know, we're not paying double for both, all right?"
"That looks right. See if it opens that door over there." She nods to the panel in the middle of the wall.
"If the boss didn't tell you, I'm not flapping my chops about it, neither."
She bristles. "What're you saying? It's... hot down here. That's all." She shivers again.
"Stand back!"
"Get ready for anything!"
"Where's the rest?"
"Dereo took his time sending you. You got the key?"
"Key?"
"Dereo sent me to get an old Huana artifact, not a key."
"Perhaps you mean the Cornett of Waves?"
"Even if he did, I'd know better than to announce that to a stranger."
"You'll watch your tone with me if you want to get it."
"If you say so. All I care about is opening that door." She nods to the big panel in the middle of the wall.
"Come on, I'm just ready to get this over with." She peels a strand of sweat-slick hair from her neck.
"You were supposed to pay our friend Takano a visit. Relieve him of some old relic."
"You got it or not?" She snugs her arms more tightly around herself.
[Present the Cornett of Depths.] "Is this what you're looking for?"
"But why does Dereo want this mosaic?"
"This mosaic must be important. It's obvious you don't like being here."
"Part of Neketaka collapsed down here long ago. I'm sure there are some pretty pickings in the ruins..."
"Anyway, if the boss wants something, I don't question his orders."
"Once Dereo's got what he wants, you can dig around all you like."
"I see."
"The sooner we get that door open, the sooner we can get back to fresh air and warm company."
"This place is full of Ondrite imagery - waves, shells, the statue. Is it a place of worship?"
"Why don't you do it?"
"I want to ask you about something."
"I'm supervising." She steps back, suppressing another shiver.
[Leave] "Very well."
"Finally."
"Dereo said there was a whole temple back here. "

"Is that it?"

She growls in exasperation, looking past you.
"What exactly are you looking for?"
"There's an old temple of Ondra. Dereo said it was just past this door." She looks around, as if hoping to find something she missed.
"I could look for this temple."
"Good luck with that."
"Hey, not so fast. Dereo didn't send either of us down here to find some piddling little shrine." She frowns, showing you a row of crooked teeth.
"Just what I was thinking." She grins, showing you a row of crooked teeth.
"I'll wait here. Come tell me when you've found it."
"What do you know about the temple?"
"Are you 'supervising' again?"
"Why don't you look for it?"
"Not much, apparently." She spits in the corner.
"Real funny." She sneers at you.
"I'm a bruiser. What do I know about cursed temples and... things like this?" She shivers.
"You're scared to go yourself."
"You know the Huana send people down here to be eaten by monstrous horrors, right?" She frowns.
"I'll see what I can do."
"No promises."
"I'll find the temple, but it's going to cost you. Up-front."
"Fine, but this is all you're getting until the job's done." She grudgingly hands you a bag jingling with coin.
"You can take whatever you can carry out of the temple. Just report back when you've found it."

"The one we need is bigger, and it should have a... very specific mosaic. You'll know it when you see it."

She looks at the mildewy walls and wraps her arms around her shoulders again.
"What does he want with a mosaic of Ukaizo?"
Her smile freezes on her face.
"I know you're a big name among the Príncipi, but I'm in no place to go talking about this."

"Dereo's the only one to talk about Dereo's business. If I was you, I'd forget about this and take my pay.

"But it's your neck." She shrugs.
"You don't give me orders. Get that straight right now."
She holds up her hands.
"Take it easy. I'm just trying to get out of here."
"Ekera, I hope we plan on carrying some to a museum?"
"What're you waiting for? See if there's a way to open that door with that shell... thing."
"I don't care where you found it as long as it gets us into the temple."
She looks you up and down.

"Good lass."

Serafen winks at Gwenfin.
"That's what the boss is hoping. And if you figured that much on your own, that's a good sign."
"Let's get this over with."
"It's darker'n Ondra's asshole here."
"All yours. Dereo said you know what to do."
"Who's there?!"
"That's not usually the reaction I get..."
She dismisses you with a wave of her hand.
"This looks like a temple to me."
"What do you know about the temple?"
"Not much, apparently." She spits in the corner.
She spits onto the stone tiles and leans close, giving you appraising eye.
"Don't know why you're asking me when you're the priest."
"Don't know why you're asking me when you're the scholar."
"Anyway, I thought you knew all about that weird, arcane stuff."
"Used to court a girl who did that whenever I stopped by. Miss her."
"If you would steal or damage a shrine to Ngati, then may the water around you fill with sharks."
"Anyway, I thought you knew all about that weird, arcane stuff."
"Don't know why you're asking me when you're the priest."
"Don't know why you're asking me when you're the scholar."

"I'm gonna watch her, make sure she supervises proper."

Edér winks and shuffles back and away from your position. He gives you a nod of reassurance from a safe distance.
"I'm right weary o' yer pointin' and gummin'! Take that shell and open yer nether-clove!"

"I didn't understand any of that, but I'm not going near that door.

"Or him." She points at Aloth.
"How nice to see Dereo employs true professionals."
"I'm still holding the purse strings, wizard."
"Ngati would sink the island beneath the waves before handing it over to pirates."
"Well it's a good thing I paid extra close attention to that mural before it vanished forever." Maia rolls her eyes.
"A surprising number of people are interested in this 'mythical' city."
"If Dereo be sending his ships up Woedica's ashy hole on an old bit of bait, who're we to be stopping him?"
"Carry it your grave as far as I care."
"Can it, mama's boy."
"Looks like Dereo sent me a capable sort at last."
"The hel's Dereo thinking, sending someone like you?" She shakes her and sighs.
